Text: Thank you so much Boobsman! It says it works with 2.0... Is this going to be like Soul Calibur V that it only works with 2.0 on certain drives? Or will this work on my Lite-On? Also, Do I need to apply your "LT3.0 ISO Patch To LT2.0 for FFXIII-2" or is this free-standing, ready to go on all 2.0 models? (I am not capable of playing online)

@ Robstar360, no sorry for the mistake on Soul Calibur V, that will work on all LT2.0 drives, i cut n paste the description from my FF 13-2 release n did not see my mistake :( 
Both this and SC 5 will work on LT2.0 machines as long as they are not patched, its only the PAL Complex release of FF13-2 that has been patched for LT3.0 n needs to be downgraged, which i have also posted :)
@Robstar360 if you havent updated your 360 to LT3.0 then u need to use the LT3.0 ISO Patch To LT2.0 for FFXIII-2.

isrmicha:

You need a lite-on iHas burner to burn XGD3 games.  Truncate does not work.  I have both the iHas124 and iHas324 and they both work fine for these XGD3 games.
steelllynx i have Truncated Souls Calibur V,and it worked just fine
I`ve a problem i use iso 2 god, it tells me Failed to open Iso image Reason: Unable to read beyond the end of the stream!
i burned 2 discs with error on 96% , this iso is damaged, as no one yet said that is working.

This copy is saying unsupported disc, BenQ 360 drive, LT+ 2.0.  I burned with a Verbatim DL on a properly flashed iHas drive.  Other XGD3 games work such as Sonic Generations.

What could I have done wrong where this says Unsupported disc?  It shows the game logo where it is supposed to.

Can anyone confirm that this iso actually works? I burned using an IHas drive with the correct firmware/settings and i got 2 coasters at around 60%. 

Ive successfully burned a few XGD3 games before, so i think this is a bad iso.

Nevermind, i was finally able to get a successful burn tweaking a few settings. The game runs fine when installed to HD.

I can confirm that it does work.
